context: If Mia prepares a detailed study plan, then she organizes her study materials efficiently. If Mia attends a study group session, then she gains new insights into the material. Mia is confident that she will either prepare a study plan or attend a study group session, or both. If Mia gains new insights into the material, then she practices a variety of problem sets. If she practices a variety of problem sets, then she masters the subject. If Mia discusses topics with a knowledgeable friend, then she reinforces her understanding through discussion. She also trusts that either she gains new insights or discusses topics with a friend, or both. If Mia reinforces her understanding through discussion, then she feels well-prepared for the exam. If she feels well-prepared for the exam, then she scores highly on the exam.
question: If Mia did not organize her study materials efficiently and did not master the subject, did she score highly on the exam?

axiom WellPrepared : Prop
axiom Score : Prop

axiom h1 : Plan → Organize
axiom h2 : Group → Insights
axiom h3 : Plan ∨ Group
axiom h4 : Insights → Practice
axiom h5 : Practice → Master
axiom h6 : Discuss → Reinforce
axiom h7 : Insights ∨ Discuss
axiom h8 : Reinforce → WellPrepared
axiom h9 : WellPrepared → Score

  have hI_to_M : Insights → Master := fun hi => h5 (h4 hi)
  have notI : ¬ Insights := fun hi => notMaster (hI_to_M hi)
  have d : Discuss := by
    cases h7 with
    | inl hi => exact False.elim (notI hi)
    | inr hd => exact hd
  have r : Reinforce := h6 d
  have w : WellPrepared := h8 r
  exact h9 w
</lean>
ANSWER: Yes

context: If David submits the application for the grant, then the grant committee evaluates the application. If the grant committee evaluates the application, then the project receives grant funding. The research team anticipates that either David submits the application or the team works on a pilot study, or both. If the team works on a pilot study, then the study identifies key areas for improvement. If the lab installs new equipment, then the efficiency of experiments improves. The team also thinks that either they work on a pilot study or the efficiency of experiments does not improve, or both. If the study identifies key areas for improvement, then the project timeline is adjusted accordingly.
question: If the project did not receive grant funding and the lab installed new equipment, was the project timeline adjusted accordingly?

iterations.llm_response:
<lean>
axiom DavidSubmits : Prop
axiom CommitteeEvaluates : Prop
axiom GrantFunding : Prop
axiom PilotStudy : Prop
axiom IdentifiesAreas : Prop
axiom NewEquipment : Prop
axiom EfficiencyImproves : Prop
axiom TimelineAdjusted : Prop

-- Premises
axiom a1 : DavidSubmits → CommitteeEvaluates
axiom a2 : CommitteeEvaluates → GrantFunding
axiom a3 : DavidSubmits ∨ PilotStudy
axiom a4 : PilotStudy → IdentifiesAreas
axiom a5 : NewEquipment → EfficiencyImproves
axiom a6 : PilotStudy ∨ ¬ EfficiencyImproves
axiom a7 : IdentifiesAreas → TimelineAdjusted

-- Conclusion to prove: If the project did not receive grant funding and the lab installed new equipment, then the project timeline was adjusted accordingly.
theorem timeline_adjusted : (¬ GrantFunding ∧ NewEquipment) → TimelineAdjusted := by
  intro h
  have hNotG : ¬ GrantFunding := And.left h
  -- From DavidSubmits → CommitteeEvaluates → GrantFunding, ¬GrantFunding implies ¬DavidSubmits
  have hNotD : ¬ DavidSubmits := by
    intro d
    apply hNotG
    exact a2 (a1 d)
  -- From DavidSubmits ∨ PilotStudy and ¬DavidSubmits, deduce PilotStudy
  have hP : PilotStudy := by
    cases a3 with
    | inl d => exact False.elim (hNotD d)
    | inr p => exact p
  -- Then IdentifiesAreas and finally TimelineAdjusted
  exact a7 (a4 hP)
</lean>
ANSWER: Yes

axiom strat_imp_workflow : M → W

  have t : T := attend_or_not_approved.elim (fun ht => ht) (fun hna => False.elim (hna a))

  exact strat_imp_workflow m
</lean>

axiom Join : Prop
axiom Learn : Prop

axiom Health : Prop
axiom Success : Prop

theorem marathon_conclusion
  (h1 : Routine → Improve)
  (h2 : Join → Learn)
  (h3 : Routine ∨ Join)
  (h4 : Learn → Practice)
  (h5 : Practice → Goals)
  (h6 : Buddy → Motivated)

  have notRoutine : ¬ Routine := by

  -- From Routine ∨ Join and ¬Routine, derive Join
  have hj : Join := by
    apply Or.elim h3
    · intro r

    · intro j
      exact j
  -- Derive Goals from Join, contradicting ¬Goals
  have l : Learn := h2 hj
  have p : Practice := h4 l
  have g : Goals := h5 p
  exact False.elim (hNotG g)
</lean>
ANSWER: Yes

axiom Submits : Prop
axiom Reviewed : Prop

axiom Launched : Prop
axiom Workshops : Prop
axiom MarketingImproves : Prop
axiom SalesIncrease : Prop
axiom Interviews : Prop
axiom MediaExposure : Prop
axiom Hit : Prop

axiom ax1 : Submits → Reviewed
axiom ax2 : DistributorConfirms → Launched
axiom ax3 : ¬Reviewed ∨ ¬Launched
axiom ax4 : Workshops → MarketingImproves
axiom ax5 : MarketingImproves → SalesIncrease
axiom ax6 : Workshops ∨ Interviews
axiom ax7 : Interviews → MediaExposure
axiom ax8 : MediaExposure → Hit

theorem goal : (Submits ∧ ¬SalesIncrease) → Hit := by
  intro h
  have _hs : Submits := h.left
  have hni : ¬SalesIncrease := h.right
  have hWI : Workshops → SalesIncrease := by
    intro hw
    have hm : MarketingImproves := ax4 hw
    exact ax5 hm
  have hnW : ¬Workshops := by
    intro hw
    exact hni (hWI hw)
  have hA : Interviews := by
    cases ax6 with
    | inl hw => exact False.elim (hnW hw)
    | inr ha => exact ha
  have hE : MediaExposure := ax7 hA
